Welcome to TED Search’s documentation!¶

Initializes Node and TwoWayNode classes for building linked list data structure

class node_.Node(data=None, next=None)¶

Node representation for building linked lists

get_description()¶

() -> str

Returns the desciption of video out of linked list

get_id()¶

() -> str

Returns the video id out of linked list

get_ted_link()¶

() -> str

Returns the ted link out of linked list

get_tf()¶

() -> str

Returns the term frequency out of linked list

get_title()¶

() -> str

Returns the title out of linked list

get_translator()¶

() -> str

Returns the translator out of linked list

get_views()¶

() -> str

Returns the views out of linked list

head()¶

obj -> obj

Returns the head of the linked list

>>> val = Node()
>>> val.data, val.next = 4, Node(5, Node(7))
>>> val.head().data
4
tail()¶

obj -> obj

Returns the tail of the linked list

>>> val = Node()
>>> val.data, val.next = 4, Node(5, Node(7))
>>> val.tail(val).data
7
class node_.TwoWayNode(data=None, next=None, previous=None)¶

Two way linked list representation

Cleans and stems the lexicographical unit

normalizer.stemmer(word)¶

str -> str

Stems the word

>>> stemmer("перепонами")
'перепон'
>>> word = 'до та після конференції'
>>> word = stop_words_removal(word)
>>> print(word)
['конференції']
>>> stemmer(word[0])
'конференц'
normalizer.stop_words_removal(transcript)¶

str -> list

Returns the list with stop words removed

>>> stop_words_removal('з пригодами')
['пригодами']

Retrieves, cleans and saves subtitles using api

data_collector.collect_data()¶

() -> ()

Saves all files with subtitles in ‘data’ folder

data_collector.data_cleaner(f)¶

() -> ()

Returns a file with clean information

Retrieves data from csv file

class csv_reader.FileExplorer¶

Retrieves columns from csv file

csv_reader()¶

Reads a ted_metada_kaggle.csv file

Returns a list of ids

>>> FileExplorer().csv_reader()[:4]
   Unnamed: 0  comments  ...     views  vidID_youtube
0           0      4553  ...  47227110    iG9CE55wbtY
1           1       265  ...   3200520    rDiGYuQicpA
2           2       124  ...   1636292    NEjZt0y6OOw
3           3       200  ...   1697550    gQ-cZRmHfs4

[4 rows x 19 columns]
getter(i, parameters)¶

str -> int

Returns the number of views given the video id i

>>> file = FileExplorer()
>>> file.getter('iG9CE55wbtY', ['views']).next.data
47227110
id_retriever()¶

() -> list

Returns the list of video ids

>>> file = FileExplorer()
>>> ids = file.id_retriever()
>>> len(ids)
2550
>>> for i in range(3):
...    print(ids[i], end = ', ')
iG9CE55wbtY, rDiGYuQicpA, NEjZt0y6OOw,

Performs searching

class search.Search(ks)¶

Performs a search through subtitles

indexer()¶

() -> list

Returns a sorted by normalized term frequency list of linked lists

>>> word = Search('глобальне потепління')
>>> print(word.talks[0])
alinakozoriz o08ykAqLOxk.json 24 1103 45.85741528659984
node_pusher()¶

() -> list

Returns the list of linked lists related to each talk

>>> word = Search('глобальне потепління')
>>> talks = word.node_pusher()
>>> print(talks[0].get_id(), talks[1].get_id())
o08ykAqLOxk.json rUO8bdrXghs.json
>>> talks[0].get_title()
'How we can make the world a better place by 2030'
>>> talks[0].tail().previous.previous.data
1141254
translator_search(video_id)¶

str -> int

Returns the number of videos translated by the same person

>>> search = Search('одяг')
>>> talk = search.node_pusher()[0]
>>> search.translator_search(talk.get_id())
1
